intro: Aulomyrcia reticulata var. dives, commonly known as the red-flowered nettle tree, is a species native to parts of South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, net-veined leaves and clusters of small, bright red flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The flowers attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
